action.action-desc: Mr. Schiff (for himself, Mrs. Cherfilus-McCormick, and Ms. Omar) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To prohibit educational institutions that require students to provide information with respect to their menstrual cycles from receiving Federal funds.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Privacy in Education Regarding Individuals' Own Data Act or the PERIOD Act.

section.header: Prohibition on receipt of Federal funds for certain educational institutions

subsection.text: No Federal funds may be made available to any educational institution that requires any student at, or served by, such institution to provide information with respect to the menstrual cycle of such student.

paragraph.text: The term educational institution means a local educational agency, State educational agency, elementary school, secondary school, or institution of higher education.

The terms elementary school, local educational agency, secondary school, and State educational agency have the meanings given the terms in section 8101 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7801).
The term institution of higher education has the meaning given the term in section 102 of Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1002).
